title: Typographic illustration C&C
content:
Looking for C&C on my latest typographic illustration for my website.. [www.sisudesigns.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015160843/http:/www.sisudesigns.com/ "www.sisudesigns.com")

Joseph
author: iggyboo

comments.content:
C&C? -Baby, what's that meant to me

Command and Conquer...nah. Must be designer lingo.
comment and critique... although tiberian sun 3 c&c should be out soon :O) Iam tank rushing...... man iam such a dork.

Not sure what that reference is, but it can't be any dorkier than the time my office-mates got me to read the following aloud:

I am Sofa King  
We Todd did.

When I said what does it mean? Trying to contain their glee, they said I needed to say it louder. So I did. When the puzzled look on my face indicated I still was clueless, they said I need to almost yell it. I think I got it after that.

Now when I do something stupid, I say "Way to go, Sofa King!"

(corrected with Samadam's help below)

I don't have any real comments or crits for you (and btw, I knew what C&C were). It is a beautiful site, i love the logo, the navigation style of scrolling to the right, the coat of arms, the Citgo, everything. Nice work.

And by the way, fontplayer, it would have been better to say:  
I am Sofa King  
_We_ Todd did.  
Makes more sense syntactically and sounds better.

_And by the way, fontplayer, it would have been better to say:_

Actually, not that you mention it, I think that is what they put, and it makes it easier to see how they fooled me (a little)  
; )

Oh, and btw, I love the design work also.

you guys are a riot... lol Good times thanks for adding a smile to my day. "Sofa King. we todd did!."

Joe

Joe,  
I enjoyed the broadsheet style of your page. Ill remember to take a look next time Im in front of a nice cinema display.

P.S. My apostrophe key isnt happy, sorry :o(
